conversations.content: Saint Starfall, gooooo!
Somebody's sure raring to go. You really like Dragonyule that much?
I do, but there's more to it than that.
For the crystalia, Dragonyule is an extremely important event!
...Crystalia? That some kinda rash?
No, silly. That's the name of my people! You know how I can freeze anything?
Well, that's because I'm one of the crystalia tribe. We have the power to control the cold!
Huh! No fooling? So, why's Dragonyule so important to you guys?
Because it's the day we do the ice crystal ceremony!
In it, we offer up prayers for a blessed Dragonyule, then make snow fall from above. It's a super special event for us.
That sure explains why you're so amped up. Well, go get 'em, tiger. And lemme know if there's anything I can do to help.
I will! Thanks, Luca. I'll get right to it...
...as soon as I figure out what ＂it＂ is.
Aren't you supposed to be the expert?! Uh, well, maybe you could look in on how everyone in the Halidom is doing?
The fact that we've got people keyed up over Dragonyule means there's gotta be some folks who're crying ＂bah, humbug.＂
How could you not love Dragonyule?
I'm just saying, we've got as many kinds of people here in the castle as there are stars in the sky.
Some folks, like Durant, don't like to get too cozy with others, while people like Odetta are kinda hard to figure out.
That's why I'm thinking maybe you should lend a helping hand so that EVERYONE can get into the spirit of the season. Y'know?
Oooh, what a great idea! I'll do that. First order of business is—
Oh, wait. I promised I would talk to Lowen and some others about the Dragonyule party!
I totally forgot! Now I'm late!
Aha ha... Hope the poor girl doesn't run herself ragged.
Lowen! Maribelle!
Hello, Lily. What's with the outfit?
Ooh, I know why she's dressed like that! She's all pumped up because we're gonna talk about the Dragonyule party. Am I right, or am I right?
Hee hee...
Okay, now that Lily's here, let the party planning begin!
Just us three? Without any adults?
I'M an adult, thankyouverymuch!
Aha ha... We were actually wondering if maybe this year we could do it with just us.
But why?
So that people will realize we're adults, too! Obviously!
We want to prove that we can do a good job of it on our own.
You mean to your sister?
Uh-huh. And the prince, and everyone else.
Besides, they all seem really busy with their work.
That's why it's up to us to bring this party to life without anyone's help! Assuming we can manage it...
Hmmm...
(Wait! This sounds like it could be a job for Saint Starfall!)
(All right. It's go time!)
Don't you worry! You can leave everything to your good friend Saint Starfall Lily!
Saint Starfall...Lily?
That's right! I'm gonna make sure everyone has a happy Dragonyule this year...by assuming the role of Saint Starfall myself!
You just leave it all to me, okay?
I'm gonna give this one hundred—no, TWO hundred percent so that we can throw a rip-roaring party, no help required!
Wow, Lily. You really make it sound easy!
That settles it, then. You'll be our leader, Lily!
Let's call Elias and Pia, too!
Good thinking! And we can't have a party without food. Ooh, and presents!
I can tell this won't be easy... But I'm Saint Starfall Lily, and I won't give up!
I swear on my name that this will be the happiest Dragonyule ever!
I can tell this won't be easy... But I'm Saint Starfall Lily, and I won't give up!
Don't forget, you've got us on your side. Let's do this together!
This'll be the party to end all parties!
Yahooooo!
And so, preparations for a special Dragonyule by kids, for kids proceeded unexpectedly smoothly.
Okey-doke, Lily. Presents are all you!
This is the money we got from everyone to buy gifts. Here, you hang on to it.
Got it. I'm off to buy some presents!
See you later!
Tra la laaa...
Eep!
Heh. Sorry, little lady.
It's okay! A little accident or two isn't enough to get Saint Starfall down.
Now, everyone's waiting for their presents!
La la laaa! What to get, what to get?
Maribelle goes to school, so maybe she'd like something to help her study?
As for Lowen, Louise was saying that he wants some books.
Hee hee! Saint Starfall Lily's present game is ＂on point!＂ That's what Luca said, at least!
Excuse me, ma'am? I'd like this picture book, please! I'll just get the money, and...
Wait.
The money—it's gone!
(I can't believe this... Everyone trusted me with their money, and I lost it.)
*sniffle* No. I can't cry. I WILL find it.
No luck. What am I going to do?
Huh? Who's there?!
Victor? What are you doing here?
Castle's all in a tizzy about you not comin' home yet. I'm part of the search party.
It's way past curfew. You know that, don't you?
I... I'm sorry...
Most important is that you're okay. What are you doing out here this late?
I... I was looking for something.
Yeah? And what's that?
Money! Everyone pooled their money and trusted me to keep it safe, but then I went and lost it. *sniffle*
I'm supposed to be Saint Starfall, and yet here I am, empty-handed.
I can't go back home now! Not yet!
Well, you've gotta. Everyone's worried sick about you.
But—
I get that you're trying to be responsible. But you're just making everyone worry.
Urgh...
Listen here, Lily.
Saint Starfall visits good little kids. I'm sure he sees how hard you're working.
But if you make everyone else worry more than they already have, he's gonna put you on the naughty list.
Now, let's get you home.
Urgh... *sniffle* Okay, Victor. I'm sorry for making people worry.
Did somebody order an extra-large batch of my grandma's special soufflé cake? Because I've got one!
I'm all finished with the Yuletree! All that's left are the presents.
(I have to apologize to everyone, but I just can't work up the nerve.)
(I finally made friends after so long. Now they're gonna hate me...)
Lily, where'd you put the presents?
(I have to tell them that this is all my fault. I just have to be honest!)
Um... I... You see—
Whoa! Everyone, look!
Presents are...falling from the sky?!
Holy smokes, Lily! I can't believe you came up with something this awesome!
I... This...
(Could it be...?)
Thank you...Saint Starfall.
Now, let's get this Dragonyule party started!
Yeah. Let's!
Happy Dragonyule, children!
Happy Dragonyule! Let's have some fun, everyone!
Hey, Lily!
Everyone looks like they're having a great time. What are you all doing?
It's a party, Lily! A Dragonyule party!
Just a small one, though. Figured we'd make a little noise, get some food, exchange presents, that sort of thing.
But hey, not every party's gotta be a rager. You should join us, by the way!
Thanks, Luca. I will!
Tch...
What about those two? Shouldn't we invite them?
I don't think they'd join in even if we did.
Well that's kinda sad. I'm gonna try, at least!
Wait, I—aaand she's gone. Welp. Good luck with those party poopers, kid.
Hey, aren't you lonely over here? Come party with us!
Shut up. I ain't gettin' involved.
I don't like big crowds. Makes me feel tied down.
Hrmmm... Fine, but I'm not gonna give up on you! Just you wait!
A few days later...
Durant! Odetta!
Aw. They just ran off.
Do they hate me or something?
Heya, Lily. Why the long face?
Euden... Can we talk?
I see. So they up and left, huh?
Do you think I offended them somehow?
No, not at all, Lily. Those two can be... Well, let's just say they're not the most straightforward people around.
I do want to ask, though—why are you trying so hard to get them to join in?
*sniffle* It's just that they seem so... lonely. It makes my heart hurt a little.
Lonely?
Yeah, like...they're all on their own. Isn't that kind of sad? I was really lonely by myself until I met you and everyone else.
I don't want them to feel like I did.
Lily...
Damn kid... I'm calling shenanigans on the crying.
Aw. The Mad Dog, moved by a little girl's tears. Turns out you're actually a softie.
You LOOKING for a beatdown?
Not really. But...she's crying for us, you know.
What, so she just decides on her own that we're ＂lonely＂ and then has the nerve to start bawlin' about it? Talk about annoying.
Indeed. Even if we are alone, you and I no longer feel loneliness.
At some point, solitude became the new norm for each of us.
Psh, speak for yourself. I got friends.
Hee hee. Sorry. But you aren't exactly the most trusting guy in the world, are you?
In that way, you and I are the same—we instinctively keep distance from people. We don't feel loneliness. In fact, our solitude is our strength.
But by the same coin, that strength comes at the cost of our ability to show kindness— the kindness those tears of hers represent.
If we had someone to reach out to us before we got accustomed to being alone, the way she did, maybe things would have been different.
Instead of shielding our hearts in sinew, we could've opened them to affection... And we could've ended up like her. Maybe.
No point in wondering ＂what if.＂ If I were nicer, I wouldn't be the guy I am now.
But hey, I'm not heartless enough to shake off the kid's gesture.
Well said. Shall we go, then?
Hey. Turn off the waterworks, kid. Saint Starfall ain't no crybaby.
Durant... Odetta...
If you've got something on your mind, you should just spit it out.
Doesn't make a lick of sense for you to get up in our faces day after day, shoutin' about party this and party that.
I'm sorry...
And I'll have you know that I'm not lonely at all. Flying solo's just how I do things.
Really? I don't understand.
Our hearts don't hold the same kindness yours does. Likely because we've never come across anyone quite like you before.
I... Um... What?
Hee hee. Maybe this is all still a bit over your head. But with all that said...
I wouldn't mind talking with you more. My gut tells me you know a thing or two about a whole world I'm unfamiliar with.
Will you allow me to accompany you to a party?
*gasp* Really?! You want to go to a party with me?
Thought we made that clear.
Yay! Thanks so much, you two!
Right. The party venue awaits!
See you around, you two. It's Dragonyule. Have some fun.
We'll be going now. Off to a new world, escorted by an adorable little Saint Starfall.
She doesn't make a lick of sense. ...Hey, wait up!
I really can't believe she's managed to rope them into the group.
It's a Dragonyule miracle...and all precisely because our kind friend Lily knows what it means to be lonely.
It's not snowing.
No, it isn't. It looks as though we'll be celebrating a dry Dragonyule this year.
No fair! It's not Dragonyule without snow! This is the worst holiday EVER!
We can't control the weather, dear.
Nooo! NOOO!
What is it, Lily?
I'm gonna do it.
Huh? Do what?
Hey! Where are you going, Lily?! LILY!
Euden! I have a request!
You gave me a start there, Lily. What's this all of a sudden?
Um, I'd like to borrow a dragon!
What in the world for, Lily?
I'll tell you! Here, listen. *whisper whisper*
I see. Interesting...
That night...
Midgardsormr, I'm leaving everything in your hands tonight. Er, claws.
Thank you, Mr. Dragon, sir!
Verily. Hold on tight. We are off!
Wooooow!
We're almost right above the village. You ready, Lily?
Yeah. I picked tons of cute little flowers, so we'll take them, and...
Freeze them...and let them fall, just like snow! Sprinkle sprinkle!
Hey... Is this snow?!
Mom, look! It's snowing! ...Huh?
Wait, this isn't snow. They're little flowers!
You're right. What a marvelous thing!
Mom! Now there's PRESENTS coming from the sky!
It's a Dragonyule miracle! Huh, Mom?
Right you are, sweetie. Right you are.
Flower snow and presents... You think they're all happy with it?
I'm sure they are. Look—there are lights all over, illuminating the darkened village.
I'm sure they're all looking up into the sky right about now.
There was a child in town today who was heartbroken to hear there wouldn't be any snow falling tonight.
And I... I just hate the idea of anyone being sad like that.
That's why I wondered if there might be something I could do about it.
That's when I remembered how happy everyone was that time I gave them all ice flowers!
Oh yeah. I do recall that.
Taking their sorrow and turning it into beautiful, sparkling happiness...
Now that's a gift I knew I could give!
Oh, and Victor taught me how to do the parachute presents. Hee hee.
(Wielding her experience to benefit others... Lily sure has grown.)
(She's not just a child waiting for gifts. She's a young woman whose kind heart compels her to give back.)
Do you think I've done a good job? Do you think they feel the holiday spirit?
I just want to give back to others what Saint Starfall gave to me back then.
You've done more than good. You've done amazing tonight, Saint Starfall Lily.
Awww, thanks!
All right. Letter finished.
(I hope she writes me back.)
(Oh, Sister...)
(I've already sent so many letters, but haven't gotten a single reply.)
Could something have happened?
No, of course not! She's fine. I know it.
I wrote all about how I helped out with Dragonyule this year, so I'm sure she'll want to write me back this time!
Won't she...?
Lily!
Eek! You surprised me. What is it?
Um, we brought you a Dragonyule present!
You did? But—
No buts! Not after you went so far out of your way to help prepare for the party.
Think of it as our little way of saying thanks. Here you go!
Ta-daaa! They're cookies! Lowen's big sister taught us how to make them.
Louise is a whiz in the kitchen. I only hope we were able to do her recipe justice.
They smell amazing! Thanks so much!
Looks like they beat us here.
Odetta! Oh! And—
Mr. Rough 'n Tumble!
Maribelle! You can't just call people ＂rough 'n tumble＂!
We came to give Lily a gift.
You too? We just gave her some cookies.
Y'know, to show her how we appreciate her hard work as Saint Starfall!
Well, that makes four of us, then. Would you accept this gift from us, Lily?
We got you this hairpin. It's designed to look like a snowflake. Pretty, isn't it?
Durant's the one who picked it out, believe it or not.
What?!
Don't slander me with lies, dammit! Sheesh...
Anyway, I said we'd give you a gift, so...  Here. Knock yourself out.
Thank you! I'll treasure it forever!
Huh? Whoa!
Hee hee. We must all be thinking the same thing.
We're all so grateful to you, Saint Starfall Lily.
You gave us the gift of happiness, and for that, we thank you.
Three cheers for Lily!
Aw, you guys!
All this time, I've only ever frozen things... but now, my heart is full and warm!
I could never have had such a happy holiday if I didn't have all of you.
(I'm tickled with these gifts, but you know what matters most?)
Even though I was Saint Starfall, you all showed me the spirit of the season.
Thank you so much for giving me the gift of a happy Dragonyule, everybody!
